results.title: Athletics: the sprint
results.creator_credit: Colin Moffat, Elizabeth Isaacs, Dan Productions and Guardian Royal Exchange Assurance
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sports training film series”.
One of a series of athletics training films. Looks at the sprinter with particular emphasis given to the development of running skills and starting from the blocks. Narrated by Ron Pickering.

results.title: Dashes, hurdles and relays
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and ERPI Classroom Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Athletics”.
A study of techniques for the 100 metres, 200 metres and 400 metres sprints; three types of good form for hurdling; and the technique of passing the baton in relay races.

results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and ERPI Classroom Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Athletics”.
Slow-motion and stop-motion are used to demonstrate the running high jump, the running broad jump, the hop-step-and-jump, and the pole valut.

results.title: Play-clay
results.creator_credit: Mary Anna Winkler, Peter Erik Winkler and ACI Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “At Your Fingertips”.
Shows how flour, salt and water can be combined to make an inexpensive modelling clay. Explains how to make and decorate various things with it. Suitable for lower and upper primary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mary Anna Winkler, Peter Erik Winkler and ACI Films

results.title: Cylinders (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “At Your Fingertips”.
Designed to help children become aware of the creative possibilities of the cylindrical shape. Using readily available materials found in the home, children create an assortment of play things, models, sculptures and screens.

results.title: Boxes (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Mary Anna Winkler, Peter Erik Winkler and ACI Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “At Your Fingertips”.
Shows a number of things that can be made by children from boxes which originally held house-hold items. Cereal boxes covered with paper and coloured become a model village; milk cartons are made into cars or trains or animals. The biggest cartons, such as those in which refrigerators are delivered, appear as a truck, with two boys as the motive power, delivering to a playhouse. Suitable for lower primary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mary Anna Winkler, Peter Erik Winkler and ACI Films

results.title: Thailand: a land of smiles
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Asian Notebook”
Presents traditional aspects of the culture of Thailand. Discusses the geography, emphasising the importance of water for travel and agriculture. Shows dances, festivals, handicrafts, and the influence of religion on Thailand’s culture.
results.description:
